holiday meals are hard. the single worst part about holidays is the meal. people you care about put a lot of time and effort into making food that is high carb, high fat, high sodium, and just plain bad for your diet... and you're encouraged to eat more than normal, because it's a holiday then there's leftovers. "we have so much, take some home with you." it's like one day of bad eating isn't enough, you're supposed to keep at it. on the way home i legit pulled over at a gas station and threw away the leftovers i was given into the garbage. it's nothing but lettuce, lemon water and hard boiled eggs for the next 3 days to undo all this damage. fuck you, holiday meals.

what do you do when you regret or are pressured to eat something but then you find that you can't stop? long rant . you know when you eat too much food that you didn't really want and it just weighs on your mind at the end of the day? i'd like to share an experience. okay story time. i went out to a restaurant this afternoon, i came for a spicy wings challenge but decided i wanted a little bit of mac n cheese too, the mac n cheese ended up being too many calories total, which was fine because i only wanted to have a little bit and shared the rest with my parents while trying some of what they ordered with it. i had some of the mac n cheese but it was not what i hoped it would be, and my parents ordered some bland fried food basically nuggets and dip , which i tried a little but didn't really want to eat. now we are waiting for the challenge, 75 of my mac n cheese is sitting there bothering me while my parents slowly eat their 12 cal meals. the challenge comes along, it's not even that challenging or spicy, and i finish in almost half the time, because i wanted to leave time to clean off the bones. i'm about to go back and the judge decides that the challenge is complete. even the wings 7 cal are not really worth the calories to me, i tell myself "one more bite's a binge", but when my dad decided to try the spice, i end up nibbling at the bones too. then i do it again, and again. after the spicy wings there was an ice cream that came along with the wings. i didn't want the ice cream, i tried to share it with my parents but they wanted me to enjoy it. i should have passed on it altogether, but i was interested in the syrup on top. however, i didn't really like the ice cream and after a few spoonfuls i decided i was satisfied, and my parents took the rest to share while i enjoyed my zero cal drink. but then when my dad gave the ice cream to my mom, he decided that i should have her non zero cal drink. sugary drinks, boba tea for example, are a serious trigger for me i'm trying to drink slowly, freaking out that there's no way for me to avoid finishing this thing, meanwhile i'm trying to make the most of it by awkwarly switching between my zero cal drink. i tell dad to try it too, now it's getting passed around like a fucking hot potato. eventually, we decide to just leave it, and i'm sipping my drink while waiting for mom and dad to finish their food, i take a bit, unsure whether i wanted to or if it was just to be social. i then for some reason took another piece of the one with fewer pieces more cals a piece . i wiped my face with a napkin in order to discretely spit it out, but i find myself taking yet another piece. now i'm making small grabs here and there for a spoonful of the mac n cheese, a spoonful of the ice cream, and just switching between everything except the leftover of the wings which is covered in napkins and out of my reach. they got it boxed, i realize i didn't really have to eat any of it. i had brought some snacks in my pocket, i end up having a piece, then decide to chew gum while we're in the car as a coping mechanism. i had recently tried to stop coping using gum. we go shopping, i get away from my family to use the restroom. i try and i almost purge. as a little bit comes up i realize that it's only probably 1 calories or so, maybe 2k at most. i convince myself at the last second it's not worth it, but now i know how. we stop at the neighbors house to tell them about the challenge. their mom offers us some apple pie, one slice for me one slice for my parents to share. i say that it's too much for me and she puts half of the slice back. it still feels like too much. i tilt my plate, pretend to finish sweep the crumbs up with my fork, as i get up to discretely throw the remaining pie in the garbage. conversation goes on, they offer us some of a chicken dish. i take as little rice as possible because i wanted to try it, and two pieces of chicken. i didn't want to eat another meal, but i wanted to try a little bit and it would have been awkward not to. my hands get messy while eating the food, i grab a napkin and wipe off the sauce to try ans save calories. but i end up grabbing another piece. there is drink in my pocket, i added the drink mix to my water because i thought it would go well.it did, but by the time i'm done with the chicken, i still have more drink left, i end up taking one more piece of chicken. i end up adding more even more water to the cup so i could sip while we chatted, but i knew that i should have just probably poured it out. i feel distant from the conversation while i sip my drink. we all get away from the table to talk outside, but i am super tired, and go back into my house. i should have probably tried to catch a nap but i also had to fold the laundry. but i'm so worried about stopping the binge that i just start chugging salt water, not to purge, i guess to feel full to cope in order to hold off further overeating. this has backfired on me before and it just did again i don't need satiety. i just need some hope. i am now too bloated to sleep i'll have to use the bathroom and feeling too sluggish to do laundry and it is too close to dinner time to sleep. the one good thing was that there was leftover from the large salad i had before going out to prepare me for the spicy wings , and i would be able to have that for dinner. but the neighbors gave us some of the apple pie, a different chicken and potato dish, and some bread. i end up wandering to the fridge, stressing about time passing. i know that dinner is going to roll around and i am going to have fomo. i mindlessly grab some low calorie things out of the fridge, mushrooms and such. and then, as one thing lures me to the next, the spoon comes out, and i start taking bits of the fruit that was for dessert, some salsa, more mushrooms, basically everything in sight that seems low cal enough that i might as well. but that doesn't change the feeling of the calories creeping up. i spit some things out, only to mindlessly reach for even more food, i eventually go to start the dryer, still munching on asparagus, i go to throw it in the trash, still snapping off pieces and eating it as i open the lid. i run up to my room to fold the laundry that is laying out while the dryer does the second half of it. still fighting the urge to back down, i grab 2 altoids. this is usually my go to for stopping a binge, and for the first time ever, i end up reaching for a second pair of altoids. i was probably on pace to finish folding the clothes once the dryer finished, but at that point, i just layed face down and started crying. for about 2 minutes. now dinner time has come around. i used to ask to serve myself at dinner, as a way of trying to get all the low calorie food on my plate, but as my appetite has gone down, this has just become a burden. i don't really want to say too much about dinner. i get fomo as usual, they end up making me feel guilty and selfish for the time it takes me to serve myself, because i am fumbling through the cluttered kitchen that i tried to not worry about while they sit already served. i am selfish because i am desperate. anyways, i have my salad, one bread and a little bit of the chicken potato dish. i end up getting up to grab a few more vegetables from the fridge, but when dessert comes around i have the fruit that was for dessert and pass on the pie. dad insists on each of us having a slice of the cake we had from earlier in the weekend, and i end the day by swiftly putting it in my pocket and being done after finishing the fruit. i have started my fasting window about an hour ago as i finish writing this, i still have to fold the laundry, and i'm super tired. i often look at these kind of days and wonder if it's my disordered tendencies or if it's really just me. i miss when i saw no distinction felt no need for one. to think that 1 day ago i was close to my lw and physically feeling good without even trying to hard. for me, after comfortably restricting for a good while, this is just one more reminder to never let myself want something. tldr: did a spicy wing challenge, wanted a little mac n cheese for old time sake, got pressured to eat more calories than i wanted to throughout the day. the situation combined with me bingeing on my own terms led to me crying before dinner, then still having a bunch of laundry to fold before bed this post may look kind of messy and scattered since the app messed up a few times while i was writing. anyways, let me know if you have any similar experiences or ways you handle this kind of situation.
comments by family. my aunt i last saw christmas and now saw her at easter just said "oh how thin you got" if only she knew

deathbed regrets. have i just been "waiting around" for my eating disorder to change? being locked in the upstairs of your thoughts, brain bound, i call it , gives me a dull headache. there is an art to waiting around, apparently. a craft. have i perfected that craft? waiting for change, waiting for movement, waiting for difference. the definition of insanity is doing something over and over and expecting different results. all this brain bound thinking requires mental gymnastics. who is in control of whom? am i in control of my body or is my body in control of me? my thoughts bounce backwards and forwards in my head, twisting into tangents and intrusively pushing forward until i finally take action to simmer the thoughts: throw up on the way home into this white plastic bag, crouched in this dark alley way. well now, what did i expect? i picture someone hitting my nose with a rolled newspaper. bad dog i thought once i quit starving i would be happier. i would reach this pinnacle stage of adulthood where happiness resided. i would be able to take a seat in it, relax. i wring words out of a wet rag and they plunge to the floor. maybe if i pick them up carefully, i could describe what's happening? then i could get out? i could be free? i'm like a dim child, putting squares into circles slots. anyways, waiting around. i check mirrors for years, the same reflection stares back. i eat burnt toast for years, the same emptiness grows in my chest. i drink diet coke for years, the same satisfaction singes my stomach. maybe this time, this year, this moment, the toast and diet coke will do something different for me? i wait. maybe if i dress it up a bit dress up this raging fire of an eating disorder, lol : i'll layer my dirty starving habits into my personality, knit my actions into my character, weave my eating disorder into my hair and the men that i fuck, tattoo the feeling from purging into my chest so it permanently resides, pandora's box , or maybe allow my body to heal over the pain, scarring my eating disorder into me forever, never leaving. i wait. the times when my eating disorder has been quiet in my life, it feels like standing in a quiet desert. uninhabited, desolate, wasteland. my hobbies disappear. my personality shrinks. my hair falls out. the only song that plays is "static" by godspeed you black emperor on a deafening loud volume i double dog dare you to sit in a room quietly and listen to that song in its entirety . i wait in the desert. i wait and wait and wait. i have not waited around stagnantly, either. i have moved metaphorical furniture for years, making new rooms in my head. i have changed, i have adapted, i have matured, i have seen therapists. and yet, in every version of my new self, i seem to be waiting around. maybe if i bleach my insides? strip all the wallpaper, gut my veins. oh, i can smell the sweet smell of sanitary doctor's office now. nice and clean. here's my secret: when i hear listen see young girls sorry men, can't relate to you as well. no offense talk about their blooming eating disorder, i want to beat the shit out of them. there they are, just fertilizing their thoughts and tending their depression garden. they're feeding the god damn thing they're making a home for it what the fuck here's my second secret: i have tended my depression garden for years. i made a fire for it, got it a chair, and made it comfy. i'm projecting my self inflicted anger onto younger girls. i just don't want you to do the same as me, man. the real secret of this post: i know when i'm old and on my deathbed, with white porcelain hair and opaque blue eyes, my true regret will flash before me like a series of silent videos. videos of me silently waiting around, doing the same thing over and over. amp; x2 b;

help. i already made a post about my apparent ed and it looks like i'm on the beginning stage, so i haven't actually developed anything yet. i have a dietitian which i've been seeing for some months. she helps me with guilt when eating, binging due to boredom and all that kinds of stuff. it doesn't feel like it does much for me, since my father is always with me in her appointments and i can't tell her about my ed openly. i've been seeing several posts in social media about that kind of stuff and all sings seem to indicate that i haven't improved. sure, my eating patterns are slightly better, but my mindset is still the same. there's also my mother. it looks like she's struggling with an unhealthy relationship with food as well, and she comments on how much weight she's gained or that i shouldn't eat chocolate at night because it'll make me fat, etc. she keeps making those comments quite regularly. i told my dietitian about it without actually revealing her identity, but her tips aren't very helpful when it comes to dealing with my mother's reactions towards my diet. between my mother, my dietitian's unhelpful tips, my body image issues and the stuff that's been going on in my life i find myself wishing i could skip breakfast again or work out more to lose weight. i have no one to talk to about this and i feel trapped. what can i do to improve my relationship with food?

"be healthy later". i hate how they act like i can just eat less later when i only eat once a day things to help my metabolism and still end up with too many calories to lose weight. we're going out to eat and it's already a big fuss because i don't like to have breakfast. it's like they poke and prod at the only thing i am not able to accept because they know this already. i am maybe even willing to compensate, but at this point the experience is not worth the calories. i feel genuinely crapped on and the times i've thrown up are the only times i've felt satisfied. the fact is i can't uneat shit.

i just sold my mom i should be happy but . oh my gosh oh my gosh oh my gosh oh my gosh oh my gosh oh my gosh oh my gosh oh my gosh oh my gosh oh my gosh oh my gosh oh my gosh oh my gosh oh my gosh oh my gosh oh my gosh what have i done.

all i can think about is how i'm going to burn calories but i don't feel motivated to do it. update: i just fell down the stairs trying to workout update2: at the er they asked me about my low heart rate : update3: they wanted me to stay overnight to monitor my heartrate but i was 27 hours fasted and didn't want to lose muscle all this because i was obsessing about burning calories, i'm just wanna restrict and sleep one more update: i am apparently being forced to eat 3 meals a day now

doctors visit. uh oh i've gotten myself into yet another predicament. i have to go for my annual check up in 4 days. last time the doctor was already suspicious given how much weight i lost and asked if i was overexercising or making myself throw up, but i insisted i wasn't and she didn't push further. i have gotten "worse" at my eating disorder and instead of just restricting, i've gotten into a binge purge cycle and have been maintaining around the same weight, so i'm not too worried about that... i know my heart rate has gotten slower but i do tend to get "white coat hypertension", so i'm assuming it'll even out to be a regular heart rate? i'm mostly worried about when they check your mouth throat and lymph nodes since i've been purging a lot lately. if i don't purge these next few days, do you think i'll be alright? any advice? fyi i understand doctors only want to help, the reason i am concerned about the doctor finding out is that i'm a minor and i have a strained relationship with my parents. i'm nearly 18 and off to college, and i am planning to maybe seek help once i am an adult and on my own, and this should be my last appointment until i'm 18, so i just have to make it through this time.

i binged and had a realization. it took me about an hour to make the food, and 3 hours to eat it, another hour was spent waiting for it to digest so i could go to sleep and reflecting on whether or not i regretted it. i might have low energy from not eating enough, but given the amount of thinking i do when i overeat, this also drains my energy, almost like a full time job.

my old eating experiences tend to register as things that happened way more often or close together than they really were.. my memories feel distorted because i remember being able to eat whatever i want when i want, the only problem was i was a lot heavier then and i am happier and feel better at my current weight. i wish i had a record of what i actually ate back then, because at least i would have a reference to before my problems began metabolism . whenever i challenge a food rule, i tend to challenge it again and again until it becomes excessive and i regret it. sometimes i feel like everything if i just went back up to my old weight, but i don't believe that and i don't want to commit the time.

triggered by my pre pregnancy photos videos. i'm 6mo pregnant. for some reason i thought it wouldn't bother me to go back and look at some old photos videos early 2 21 like an idiot. it made me realize that i never understood how skinny i really was? i'm having such a mix of emotions right now, wanting to hug my younger self, being angry about gaining 2 lbs healthy baby weight , and already planning how i'm going to lose weight and then some postpartum i'm sad that i was so unjustifiably embarrassed of my body back then and the ed part of my brain keeps saying "if i thought i was fat then, i must really be huge now" like yeah? i'm fucking pregnant. anyway, i am eating enough and i love this weird alien inside me. i wish i could vent to a friend, but it would just be the same awkward "aw, well you're pregnant and it's normal to feel that way. you'll lose the weight quick 6 12mo " when i really just want someone to be angry at the eating disorder with me? and be like "fuck that voice, you know you're sexy" and get dressed up to do something with me like we used to, imao rant over

i feel like my relationship with food would heal almost immediately if i didn't have to coexist with my dad. he got mad at me over something related to dinner. i pretended to eat the food, details aside i barely had anything, and then he declared that we were going out for dessert. this has left me feeling glad that i faked out of dinner, glad that i faked lunch. edit update: well we had pastries, and every bite not worth taking ended up in my pockets... ended up having a small midnight snack just to be safe, it could have turned into a binge but i'm glad it didn't. the next day i got up and actually had a normal well maybe not normal but non disordered breakfast. i think this shows that my binges are not caused by restriction, but by a desperation for control.

just wanting too share my progress w someone : . idk what im really meaning too say with this post, but since about mid feb ive been actively getting better and embracing it this time instead of scrambling too feel in control amp; like im deeply engaged in my ed. beginning too eat consistently, ive been trying let go of that feeling of urgency that i needed too get back into a mindset amp; routine that enabled amp; fuelled my ed instead just allowing myself too engage in nourishing myself properly and rly meaning it with no plan or end goal too make up or relapse. i dont know how well im explaining this lol but oh well ofc in the past month or so there have been slip ups amp; its all far from consistent. i think i still havent realised how many disordered thoughts r still lingering and whilst that comforts me i am now in a place where i can identify that its my ed that wants and clings too them thoughts and i myself can make the decision too tackle them or listen too them. being able too distinguish what i think vs what my ed thinks now is crazy actually quite proud of myself ahh i feel like im embracing 'recovery'? word creeps me out lol cause it feels too official and final but whatever too fast sometimes or not doing it right. almost wishing it felt harder or im not struggling enough. but then i think abt the 4 months or so before when i knew part of me desperately wanted too get better and i was fiercely pushing it away and fighting it off with fuelling my ed further cause i was just so scared. i kinda consider that period that id wanted amp; was ready too recover for longer than i thought. and theres no such thing as too quick: honestly just taking it day by day lol i could wake up and completely change my mind tomorrow but at least ive seen what recov can bring and how good it can feel: i think im just writing this too acknowledge how far ive come myself. no one in my family knows abt my ed in the first place amp; i think my friends just think im still engaging in it. i've thought abt telling my best friend how things have changed recently but thats scary and feels like ive gotta commit too it then oh well getting of track lol just wanted too come ok there and share with someone. i know reddit has been so helpful to me in the past and i hope all of you struggling can find peace in yourselves soon and allow yourself too get better too

how to approach my situation while keeping my girlfriend in mind. tw: there will be numbers involved so i've been with my girlfriend for almost 2 years now, when we started dating she was in a rough spot and undiagnosed with anorexia, a few months into dating her parents sent her to a recovering hospital that focuses on eating disorders. things happend there that are a whole other topic, however she got back after about a month being there and obviously there was a change in physical appearance by becoming healthier, i stuck with her the entire time and it's been over a year now shes been out. since she has been out she has still struggled mentally with her disorder but hasn't ever completely relapsed. i'm very proud of her and i dont hold her to any expectation except to keep doing well and trying to help her not hard relapse. the issue i'm struggling with though is ive gained a pretty significant amount of weight since she has gotten back, i'm not saying it's her fault but i do know a part of why that happend is because anytime she would eat or get snacks she would ask me if i wanted some and if i didnt she wouldnt want to be eat it and because of that i didnt want her to not eat so i ended up eating alot more than i normally would snack wise and everything and i have gained about 4 5 pounds over the past year give or take. again not saying it's her fault but i know it played a role. i've been at a point of wanted to lose that weight back for a few months now i just dont know how to go about it while keeping her in mind because i know it could make her want to work out alot and lose weight as well. obviously there is nothing wrong with a healthy workout routine but i'm afraid she would go to an extreme like she has before. i want to get back to my healthy athletic weight without making her feel insecure or uncomfortable and i just dont know how to go about that. so if there are any suggestions or anything i'd love the advice. and i hope this was an okay post to make without causing any problems and i'm proud of each and everyone of you :

i have arfid and i'm worried it will soon transition into anorexia soon.. tw: numbers i have arfid which is avoidant restrictive food intake disorder. the texture, smell and taste of most food is repulsive and it keeps me from eating most of the time. it had nothing to do with weight loss at the beginning and i was really scared of how much weight i was losing especially since it was accompanied by a lot of tremors and weakness cause of my low nutrient intake. i've told my mom about this multiple times and she's just been happy that i'm losing weight. i've been overweight most of my life. she's overweight as well and has serious body image issues that she also projects on to me. she's been calling me fat my entire life while doing nothing to encourage healthy eating or exercise only unhealthy diets. now that i've lost about 4 lbs in 3 months she finally likes how i look and has been praising my body. now i'm worried to gain weight again cause i don't want to deal with her comments about my body anymore. my arfid is triggered by stress caused by school. so once that calms down it might go away. when that happens and i'm eating the amount of calories that i should be i'll probably gain weight again. i don't know if i will go back to eating a healthy amount of food when most food isn't repulsive anymore. if i gain weight i know my body image issues will get worse. she just told me not to gain the weight back so i can fit into clothes for a vacation. i made one of the few foods i can eat just before that now i don't want to eat it. i wish she would stop.

i don't want to be an asshole, but.... ... the increasing amount of posts asking if they have an ed is kinda fu ed up. i don't want to invalidate anyone here, it's a subreddit about eating disorders everyone has a voice here and asking questions is almost always good. but people, please use your common sense. if you... don't eat for days at a time chew stuff and spit it out make yourself throw up after eating insert another clearly disordered behavior ... then it's kinda obvious. yes, you do have an eating disorder because you're not nourishing your body right. sorry for the rant. i hope y'all have a great day

post tinder date. i met this guy on tinder n we hit it off pretty well, we even hooked up after when we left the movie theater. he seemed pretty into me n eager to hang out with me again so i felt confident that this guy liked me. 3 days pass by, he s hardly texting me n just saying he s busy, his family is over blah blah blah. well he finally decides to call me. he goes i think we had different expectations for each other n then proceeds to tell me that he didn t expect me to be a heavier person n called me overweight. i was so stunned. i felt like my world had just stopped. that s the absolute worst thing to hear when you ve got a fucked up ed brain like i do. but for pretty much an hour he was saying well it s not a problem i just wanted to be honest. it just caught me off guard. i feel better after telling you. id been thinking about it for a few days. people can change n i feel like we could grow together. i was just in shock honestly. there was things about him that i didn t expect either but i didn t say shit so for the past 2 days i haven t been able to eat because his words have just been replaying in my head. i managed to eat a bit of something but not before i stood there for awhile n cried about this. i feel so uncomfortable n ugly i hate this is this guy a total asshole???? am i over reacting??? im definitely cutting him off cus what he said was just a big turn off for me.

a never ending cycle. i started having a bad relationship with food from my childhood. i was 6 or 7 when my sister was diagnosed with anorexia, and i've been absorbing all the toxicity of that horrible situation since then. my mother was depressed and had multiple crisis while my sister was severely underweight and had no intention to recover. i obviously was too young to understand what was going on, so i unconsciously stored all the information i was able to capture. also, i grew up with a extremely toxic friend: she was obsessing over her body, trying to be as skinny as possible even though she was clearly underweight. to make things even worse, my cousin used to repeatedly tell her sister and me to go on a diet, ignoring the fact we were literally just 1 . i basically spent my whole childhood getting upset because of my body and trying to fix the problem with useless diet plans. my coping mechanism was, unexpectedly, eating more than i should. after spending a lot of years crying over my body in a desperate need to lose weight, i decided it was the right moment to change my habits once and for all. i'll spare you the details of how i got to this point, but in 2 19 i was diagnosed with anorexia and had to start a therapy. the pandemic played me dirty, and now i ended up having the opposite problem: around the end of 2 21 i relapsed ending up eating a lot and bingeing every once in a while. as expected, i gained too much weight i won't specify the kgs, but im up 5 kilos of my ideal weight and my mental health is getting worse day by day. even if i agree with myself i'll go on a diet restrict the next day, i find myself struggling to eat less than i do. i'm stuck in this terrible situation. knowing that i can't stand being fatter than my sister and friends getting to see their perfect bodies and eating habits everyday triggers me a lot , i still unable to make an effective change. i hate my body and i can't stop thinking about it. how do i stop this cycle? id just like to live a healthy life, without my mood depending on what i eat during my day. i feel like i lost all my willpower and i need it back now. any advice? feel free to ask questions if necessary to understand my situation better

driving my friends away. i have a problem and i don t know how to fix it. my friends are getting fed up with my eating disorder. i recently got in a car accident and it spun me out of control causing me to relapse for the first time. my friends just found out that i ve been relapsing for three weeks. two of them are uninvolved in my treatment to avoid causing them to relapse. the other two are now having me send pictures of my food and will argue suggest what i should eat as i ve been told i can t survive off of applesauce. i don t know for sure but i think they re fed up with my eating disorder. my therapist doesn t think i need residential yet and i don t think going back to php is an option. i feel like i want to have both things, i want my friends to not be mad at me but i want to be skinny.

my eating disorder is ruining my relationship. for the entirety of my relationship going on a year soon , i've had an eating disorder not sure exactly which one specifically, i originally thought anorexia and now i'm thinking bulimia... restrictive in some way, i digress . anyways, my girlfriend has always been insanely supportive of all my mental health issues cause boy is there a lot and i appreciate her so much for that. that being said, in the past 3 or 4 months my eating disorder has gotten a lot worse. i've had a pretty bad eating disorder for 2 3 years now, but it had mostly just been restriction, and now i've been purging a lot. it began around the beginning of the new year when i purged a few times in one week which had never happened before , and i told her i was scared. i've gotten so much worse since then. she was supportive as ever, but since then it's become a nearly every day, maybe even a couple of times a day thing. she won't say so, but i think this is really putting a strain on my relationship. she really wants me to get help, but i really don't think i want to. i know i need help, i can feel the physical strain this disorder is putting on my body... i just can't bring myself to want it. i don't want to be dishonest with her and i try to be as transparent as possible, but i know she's also going through her own shit as well. i don't want her to have to be my therapist i have no therapist , but i also don't want to hide things from her. i feel so shitty, but no matter how hard she tries, i can't make myself want to recover. no matter how hard i try, i can't make myself want to recover. i have issues other than my eating disorder and have numerous mental health problems and am a teenager living in a not so great home, and all these factors make it harder for me to get, or even want to get help. i guess i'm kind of just venting here, but i just don't want to ruin my relationship because of this disorder, but i don't have it in me to recover yet either. if context helps, i will be graduating high school soon and will be on my own then. i'm thinking of maybe pursuing help once i am on my own in college. despite what she may say, i don't think that given my current family situation, getting help is feasible. no clue if this will give anyone a better picture either, but i am a lesbian, so we are both girls well, i'm not really a girl, but for simplicity's sake, let's just go with that if that gives you any more insight into our relationship? i guess all i'm asking for is advice from maybe someone who understands. i don't want to put all my baggage on her, but i also don't want to be dishonest with her. i know she just wants the best for me, but i can't bring myself to want help. thanks.

i m going insane. trying to change my ed again from binge to bulimia and soon to anorexia?. edit: i am insane. this is a lot to read, so thank you. last paragraph is the most meaningful to me, so skip there if you d like too. i started off with a binge ed when i was younger, gained a lot of weight and felt bad about myself. and at some point in the past couple years or so i starting exercising or restricting after binges to be even so i wouldn t gain weight and eventually so i would be losing 2lbs a week. which is a healthy amount to lose but i didn t do it in a healthy way. everyone i know has congratulated me on my weight loss 52lbs and i just went from obese to overweight on a bmi chart. i was thinking the other day and my brain thought it would be a good idea to swap to just not eating, or having negative net calories. i mean if i didn t eat i would lose weight faster. plus i had a reallyyy bad binge. so i planned on eating next to nothing just a week to make up for it. so for the past five days i ve ate on average 2 calories a day while doing 25 3 k steps. i m cold, confused, sore, and dizzy, but gosh darn it the high from not eating, plus all the steps is euphoric. i feel like after just 5 days it s becoming an addiction. going on multiple jogs and walks a day to get my steps in makes me somehow feel more energetic than i ve ever been in my life. i have so much energy but it s like i m not awake at the same time. this is fun, i m having fun, and i don t want to stop sneaking around my house, lying to people about eating. sneaking out late at night to jog. i m a straight a introverted student who is super nice to people. i don t smoke, do drugs or half the bad things other students do. now i m lying and it feels so good.. every time i get chills i smile. every step goal i set another. just 2 more, just 1 more, more, more. the sight of food makes me nauseous now, before i would feel guilt after eating but now i feel guilty for even making food to be eaten. no one cares when you have a binge ed. you are just fat. when you have bulimia and are losing weight at healthy pace even if you say out loud, i ate a weeks worth of food last night, so i m exercising it off no one cares. i ve had people tell me i m really dedicated for that. but my brain just wants me to reach the label of anorexic, which has a weight requirement, and since i m starting off the top end of overweight it will take me a while, but it s all i want right now, and what i ve wanted for 3 years. i want people to know i m so dedicated. that i am so dedicated that i m able to be sickly underweight, and i m not just a fat slob.

increasing calories?. i ve struggled with eating for as long as i could remember but fall of 2 2 was probably the worst and i lost about 3 pounds. after i was able to maintain my weight again for a few months, i started weight lifting at the gym and have been very consistent for well over a year now. however, i know i m not consuming enough calories. i drink protein shakes and eat foods high in protein and try to force myself to eat snacks through the day, but i m still not able to eat full meals. sometimes i know i m hungry and i know i need to eat and i just can t. i ll stare at my food until it makes me nauseous to look at. i ve been trying to gain 1 lbs for about 6 months and have had absolutely no progress. i don t really do any cardio or fat burning exercises. i ve tried forcing myself to eat breakfast, i ve tried eating chicken rice chicken pasta and other basic meal prep things, but it s never that good and i get sick of it so fast. i love to cook so i make myself dinner a few times a week but i end up eating maybe half a serving before i feel sick. i always bring a lunch to work and never eat it or maybe eat half. i feel like i want to eat so bad but i just can t. any advice or anyone dealt with something similar after recovering from an ed?

seeking resources and support. i feel like i m on the verge of developing an eating disorder. i m hesitant to say i have one, because i m honestly not educated enough on the topic. i m not on here for self validation or for someone to diagnose me. just need support and advice. i don t like taking to people about it because i don t want to make food an issue or maybe i m just making excuses because food is an issue for me right now. it all started in october. went through a rough breakup. got all the typical side effects of a post breakup: not leaving my bed for weeks, not eating or my body throwing it up if i did , not showering, just wallowing in pain. well it s march now. i m back to being myself in all areas except food. i m lucky if i can keep down more than one meal shake a day. weight started falling off of me and people are really noticing now. i liked the compliments at first, but now it s starting to scare me. i went from being an athlete to underweight for my height, not a muscle on my body. here s the real kicker: i have always been obsessed with how i look, being slim. i was apart of that young group of kids who got social media when they were like 12 so body image has always been an issue. theres something in the back of my mind that loves it and i m terrified that portion will take over hell it s already starting to. are there any resources, websites, organizations, anything that would help educate me? is therapy a thing for this? is there anything like tums that help settle ur stomach so u can try to eat? any tips tricks and resources would be highly appreciated. thank you for reading.

my binges are not usually foods i crave . and sometimes they are even foods i dislike. i binge on weird things.. i hear people say that they binge on foods they are craving, or foods they told themselves they couldn t eat, but for me that s almost never the case. it s whatever i happen to be eating, and every food can turn into a binge. or anything i look at really. a couple days ago was pancakes that were in pre portioned packages, i ate a weeks worth of pancakes in less than an hour tonight i had a salad, and next thing i know i was shovelling just plain mixed greens down my throat, no dressing, just straight leaves. it was kinda bitter, and vegetables are not something i ever crave. i finished the whole huge tub in less than 4 minutes. does anyone else have this happen? my binges are sometimes even with foods i hate; like peas. sometimes i just wonder what is up with my brain, because i binge on the weirdest varieties of foods. for most people it seems like a category: desserts, salty snacks, carbs, crave foods, foods that have been restricted. for me it s all over the place: sweet foods, vegetables, bland foods, spicy foods, salty, bitter, literal spices. these are some of the things i ve binged on in the past two months or so cocoa and cinnamon mixed together chicken broth with cumin swerve brown sugar peas pancakes peperettes had like 1 3 of a cup of grape seed oil, with salt mixed in it. salmon field greens spinach mix mac and cheese with shrimp brownies carrots gum sometimes i randomly eat a tsp or even tbsp of random spices or salt, because i get an intense urge to try them. i lick my plates always and occasionally eat ingredients separately which is probably bizarre to most ex. vanilla extract, cocoa powder.. . i

relapsing when i become constipated. i just think i realized a trend within my ed recovery. for the past two weeks, i ve been doing really well eating wise and mentally. i ve had little blips of like guilt? but then i d shake it off. and that s because a while back, i started drinking bone broth on an empty stomach every morning. for back ground, i used to be constipated when i was younger and had to go to the doctors for it amp; everything. then as i grew up, it was only the occasional constipation attack. but then as you can imagaine, my ed really set my gut health back when it developed about a year and a half ago. it got really bad this year and so did my gut digestive system. i became constipated basically every week and had bm only every 3 4 days. so i was really happy that i started pooping once, sometimes even twice, a day when i started drinking bone broth. and so i didn t feel bloated or anything like i usually did. and i felt really good mentally. well, this weekend, i kind of ate a lot of junk food. i mean had a lot of cookies and the fast food for the first time in literally months friday night, then ate out at applebee s for lunch saturday and had ice cream for dinner. and i m constipated again. pebbles on saturday and nothing today. and since saturday after applebee s, i ve felt really gross and bloated. i ended up relapsing and purging an hour after coming home from the restaurant. which i hadn t done in a month. i m disappointed in myself but i still feel so gross. i wish i never had an ed. i m so sick of this. i m so sick of myself.

do i have an ed? family problems and numbers . hi i m 14f and have been called slim by a bunch of ppl. it makes me feel rlly good, even when they make mean spirited jokes abt it. i love that. however, my mom has been calling me chunky recently and it rlly breaks my heart. my weight is buste: 32 taille: 27.5 hanches: 37.5 longueur: 28 in inches. sorry for it being in french, i am french myself : my mom in specific has told me i weigh too much. so i try to do 5 minute workouts after each meal, sometimes before. the problem is, i m scared of my parents making meals for me. since i m only 14, they make all my meals excluding breakfast and i hate it. i just want to be in control. as an example, today my dad made me a sandwich w lots of mayonnaise which i know helps weight gain and i went into a violent episode. this happens often. i normally end up punching my legs to relieve the stress. it s so frustrating. i m trying to tell myself that this is normal, but it s becoming harder and harder. sorry if this is more vent than anything :

how do ik if i have an eating disorder without a doc?. if this is the wrong place to ask i apologize. also do you need a doctor to correctly diagnose you? so the backstory is that i ve been losing weight recently bc i m fat. and i ve been losing it pretty fast imo i ve gone from 246lbs to 217lbs in about 1 2 months. how many calories a day do ppl with eating disorders eat? i hope that i haven t put myself into an eating disorder but as each day passes i like the feeling of being hungry more and more. i restrict a lot of things and have come to hate food and limit myself to many things. i am constantly working out. and rn i have an injury due to sports and am supposed to be only walking so no running or leg workouts but when i eat something that i think is too many calories i go out and run and am filled with anger bc of what i ate. and then after i am in great pain. is this anorexia or something else? or am i just tripping. i am constantly cutting back more and more cals. please lmk if this is the wrong place to post this and i ll ask somewhere else . is that considered anorexic? tldr: do i have an eating disorder? how many cals do people w anorexia normally eat? if this isn t the right appropriate place to ask please lmk

ed ? diabetes. female, 17 i have diabetes 1st type, insulin dependent , and i can't lose weight, but i genuinely want. my metabolism is too slow because of the disease. more than, i have to eat, cause otherwise my body will produce acetone breaking down proteins . and i won't lose weight but just end up in a hospital with a severe intoxication. i also have to eat when my blood sugar level drops, and i blame myself for eating something sweet, despite it being the only thing to help me not to die. so i physically can't lose weight easily. i can't afford fasting, so i'm on a calorie restriction, but... if i eat less than 3 kcal per day i get the same symptoms of intoxication as if i fasted. so... i eat, and eat, and eat. i'm tired of eating. any experiences with ed and diabetes? what am i supposed to do?

i don t feel like i m good enough to be around pretty people my friends. i never feel like i belong anywhere. im the only one of my friends who wears an xl. i hate being the big one. it s embarrassing because they re so beautiful and have the ideal bodies i want. i can t wear stuff like them. i can t look good like them cuz i will end up looking stupid. we went out yesterday and i was kinda tipsy and i just started thinking about if they even like me or if they just feel bad want me around for their benefit. the vibe just started to feel off so i just went home and cried myself to sleep. i just don t feel like anybody has actually genuinely wanted to be my friend and i feel like it s cuz of how i look and what i wear idk. i look stupid in any and everything i wear and i feel actually hideous i wanna disappear and starve myself to death until i look skinnier than them so i can prove everyone wrong. but it s unrealistic. i just want people to admire me and like me that s all.

does my ed have a name?. so i have a unique eating disorder, caused by medical trauma. basically, i had a 2 pound ostrich egg sized tumor in my abdomen, which made it very hard to eat for years, along with making me very self conscious it made my stomach very large and i looked pregnant . in 5th grade i got it diagnosed and removed, and went through a pretty major surgery in which i came out of with a c section type scar and medical ptsd diagnosed . i've been struggling with eating problems even after the tumor was removed, and i have been diagnosed with an eating disorder. i was wondering if anyone has any idea if there is a category for my eating disorder or not, so i put the description below. please do not read if you're worried it might trigger you. amp; x2 b; my eating disorder i think is caused by two main components. the first part is the fact that my brain isn't aware that the tumor is not there anymore, so i still feel physically sick when i eat too much this is because the tumor was so large it pushed on my stomach . the second reason is a bit more like anorexia, but still induced by my medical trauma. i'm so scared that i might develop the tumor again which i actually just did at a much smaller scale, so that doesn't help that i try to make my stomach look as far away from how it did before the surgery as possible, and i'm terrified of having a wide stomach. amp; x2 b; if you read this, thank you so much, and thank you in advance for your input :

my friend constantly talks about ed. possible trigger warning i ve known her for about 2 years now and in the past i almost had to stop being her friend because she would never stop talking about calories and body size and i told her it s extremely triggering for me. she assured me it wouldn t happen again but when we hang out it s just constantly i need to loose weight or i wish i fit into a size . the straw that broke the camels back was her sending me a snapchat video of her hunched over a toilet at work clearly puking. i sent her a message saying wtf. are you sick and she said yea it s period cramps. i am so fucking mad. i love her but she has no fucking boundaries, i told her that stuff triggers me. i get it she has eating problems too but i ve been recovering for 2 years now and she makes it so hard it s always about body image with her. i have to put on weight due to not restricting anymore and she makes snide remarks.

new dietician, trying to make progress. so i met with my new dietician today, but i already knew her from when i was in treatment last. she had worked at the treatment place and now works for the dietician place, small world. i'm currently restricting but i'm not being as super strict about it as i was about a month ago, i've become a little more lax and started adding in more variety rather than just sticking to safe foods. i was talking to her today, and she asked me what it would take for me to go to treatment, and i was honest, and i said something drastic like something medical to happen. then, later, i ironically described some medical things happening, like an ulcer from purging and some kidney function issues from laxatives. and she brought this up and referenced what i said earlier and said, "i guess our definition of severity is different." but she was right; i already had medical stuff going on; it just wasn't severe enough for me to seek treatment. the real reason i don't want to seek treatment is the age old, "i'm not skinny enough." i just want to lose more weight. i'm not underweight at all; if anything, i'm almost overweight. i hate it; i'm not going into treatment like this again. last time i went i gained 2 lbs in two months, sorry for numbers, but it was so dramatic that it put me overweight and it was horrible it left me hating my time there, i was binging and no one addressed it because i was eating, binging is an eating disorder no one helped me with it it was so frustrating. so i haven't wanted to go back at all since. but that last bit made me think about treatment. i'm not sure, though; i'm definitely not at a willing stage of going to treatment right now. maybe one day soon, who knows. overall, it was a productive appointment, but i'm still scared of what recovery looks like. idk, wish me luck.

anonymity in ed. i really find myself wanting to talk about these issues with someone, but everyone in my personal life is too much of a risk to talk to. i can't even open up to my therapist about it very much. the last time i did, 8 of our sessions became just about food. not even about how i process it, but if i actually ate or not. even though i had a dietitian i was working on that stuff with. i have to keep it secret from so many people and so many spaces... i don't have a support group for this and i'm not sure one exists. ed support groups sounds like a bad idea where everyone is just comparing against each other. i've never found one, anyway. in treatment isn't an option. i have a day job and no money for that. already in therapy. friends are too risky to talk to because they will get too involved and know all of my shit and i can't have that. they also are susceptible to being triggered by ed so i can't talk about that for such reason, too. i really want to talk to someone trans about it because i myself am trans and ed messes with that in so many ways, but again, i can't bring it up to people i know. i'm so down about it all. i'm trying so hard to keep my number weight stable, but it's so hard and i'm so alone. don't get me wrong, i don't need validation or encouragement, i just wish i wasn't by myself in being the only one who understands what this is like. i also am hopeless when it comes to recovery. i'm finding it harder and harder to find recovery stories let alone live one. every story i know seems to end in relapse and from there it just goes yo yo again. recovery, treatment, restoration, relapse, repeat. does anyone ever get away from eds? where is the hope for anything? just a vent..

here because i don t know what else to do.. i struggle daily all day with my body image. every time i look in the mirror, i m thinking negatively the entire time and i m usually nitpicking something about my face and or body. and i find a reason to look in the mirror at least 1 x a day.it s gotten to a point where i don t even want to go out of my house anymore because while i m out there, i m constantly uncomfortable and worrying about how fat i look or if someone can see that roll, blemish, imperfection, etc . and it is absolutely exhausting. i don t date because why the hell would i even bother trying to find someone to love me when i can t even remotely like myself? i don t even know if this is an eating disorder because i haven t been diagnosed, but i think it is. i m 5 6 and 155 pounds and i hate even saying that. i mean it physically makes me sick to think about my weight. i weigh myself every morning and that weight decides how much i eat that day. if it s below 155, i end up binge eating because my mind is excited that i lost weight. if it s above 155, i won t eat at all. i m huge. or i feel huge. i have curves in all the wrong places, cellulite, a double chin, rolls for days on my stomach, and so many other things. i feel like an imposter in my own body. i just hate hate hate this feeling so much and i want it all to end.

out of all of the disorders i ve struggled with, i would choose anorexia. i m not pro ana or anything like that.. ive struggled with eating disorders my whole life and i ve been on both sides of the spectrum. both are equally as bad but what makes anorexia win for me is the feedback. no one looked at me in disgust for not eating, losing weight, ect but i got made fun of for being fat and binging. it was horrible. im currently struggling with binge eating and i miss ana.

help with binge eating?. i've been struggling with binge eating all my life, ever since i was little. i first reached out for help from my mother, whom i still live with until july, and she said i was fine and nothing was wrong. but she doesn't believe in any kind of disorder unless she has it, diagnosed by a doctor or not. i've asked her not to buy the foods that trigger me the most at the store, like ice cream and other things, but she does anyway. she even gets angry when i call her out on buying it even though she said she wouldn't, and says she feels like she was doing a nice thing for me. i deeply wish this would stop, and i wish i didn't want to starve myself to balance out the binge eating. i want to lose weight, i'm desperate, but i can't with how things are going. i'm stuck where i am on the scale, i want to go down but i keep wandering upwards. i tend to eat an entire tub of ice cream in three or four days, sometimes less. even though she said nothing is wrong, i know there's something wrong with me. i overeat every day, i can never stop thinking about my next meal. food consumes my mind and once i do give in i usually overeat, feeling guilty and sick afterwards because i've eaten, and i've eaten too much. and then, right when the sickness in my stomach goes away, i'm back to wanting more food. sometimes i starve myself for the rest of the day, even if i only ate once that day, and sometimes i give into it again and just keep eating. it happens every day, and i'm sick of it. i'm not diagnosed by a doctor, my mother won't even consider taking me to get me checked out, but i have been diagnosed with severe depression and anxiety, which i know is contributing to and a result of my binge eating. i've managed to keep myself at a healthy weight, albeit on the higher side of a healthy weight, but i have a big stomach and wide hips, which just contributes to everything more, and it's also making my gender dysphoria worse i'm a trans dude, btw . i feel like this is the only place i have to go for help. please, does anyone have any advice?

started dating a super fit guy that works out 6 times a week, and hes triggering me.. he knows i got out of treatment last fall. but what he doesnt know is that i still count everything and restrict myself from going over my tdee today we went out and shared a nutella pizza had to prepare myself and pep talk myself a lot to do this, because it was hard ngl. nutella and pizza is still a fearfood of mine . it felt good since we shared it and he and i seemed to enjoy the pizza at first. but then after a while he commented something really triggering. just imagine how much calories thats in this and then he took a full fork och nutella scraped of from the pizza and said like look . i dont think he has an ed, but he did sound a bit unsure about eating the rest after, which he didn t because he said he was full look, i couldnt finish my last bit because of his comment about the calories and the fact that he didnt eat all of his 1 2 pizza. now a few hours after our date he texted me is it just me or do you also feel a bit weird after that pizza? now im going to be quite honest. there were nothing wrong with the pizza and my stomach feels fine im wondering if he has anxiety over the pizza, bevause he gets a lot of anxiety in generall over a lot of things. how can i make this work? if hes too fixated on food because of his training he will keep being a trigger for me because he reminds me of all the things i used to do. we really connect with eachother overall and he is truly like no other guy ive met, so i reallt want it to work between us. my plan is to tell him about me being triggerd when calories are mentioned. but then thwre is this knowing thought of mine that know that just his lifestyle will keep me thinking about training, body, etc. i even sometimes feel like i need to be as fit as him because thats pherhaps what he likes since he works out so much, or that he should be with someone that also works out as hard as him.

is this an eating disorder?. i ve made myself throw up bout 3 4 times throughout 8 months. i don t do it when i binge, i do it when i m counting my calories and i eat over. like if i ate a piece of pizza after i already at all my calories for the day, i would feel bad and regret it. i also think i binge. idk what is considered a binge, but sometimes when i m sad or even when i m not sad, i will eat even when i m not hungry. i get uncomfortably full and eat rapidly. i don t puke after this, but i do tell myself i m not allowed to eat tomorrow or only a little. that eventually ends in a binge. i think i m stuck in a binge restrict cycle. is this an eating disorder? what is considered a binge? yesterday i ate 4 or 5 rice krispy treats one after another. is that a binge?

i keep vomiting food i don't love or crave does anyone know what this is?. last wednesday, the 9th, i suddenly started vomiting profusely. i called 111, the non emergency health line in england, and ended up in a amp;e and the ucc before being prescribed medicine and being told to only eat bland foods like toast. i followed those instructions and it was alright at first until i suddenly started vomiting again. in hindsight, i only started vomiting toast after i started getting bored of it and craving other foods. i was then told to go 24 hours without food and to try toast again. i did so and vomited it immediately after i finished it. i had been craving some biscuits on my desk and ended up giving into it, both because i was extremely hungry and just desperate for flavour. for some reason, i didn't throw up the biscuits. immediately, i assumed i must be having a reaction to an ingredient. i tried a couple more things and discovered that chocolate was totally fine but salted crisps and pain au chocolats weren't okay, and would quickly get vomited once i finished them. on a whim, i decided to try a flavour of crisps i preferred more, prawn cocktail. for some reason, i didn't vomit this. this didn't make any sense to me as these had all the ingredients in the salted crisps and more. this then lead me to the possibility that i'm not vomiting from any sort of allergic reaction. instead, i'm vomiting over a cognitive reaction. looking back, the biscuits, chocolate and favourable flavour of crisps were foods i really wanted to eat and everything else was foods i was okay with. i've gone almost 21 years without having any kind of food allergy or eating disorder. this has come on very suddenly and i'm making a post here in the off chance someone might know what's going on with me. if you have any idea what this is or any advice, please leave a comment.

if you could push a button that would lock your weight in right now no going up or down, regardless of what you do or do not eat or how you exercise would you push it?. it feels like the only way to guarantee that i m not gaining weight is to lose weight. i wish i could just press a button and never have to think about it again. it s not just because my weight is pretty low now, i felt like i wish i could lock it in at a healthy weight too.

i wanna wear this dress, but i m scared of the comments. i recently bought the dress and was dolled up, and my mom took pictures and posted them on facebook. i got a lot of love from my friends and family, and today while at church, my mom showed my uncle and great grandfather. i haven t seen them in almost a month since i ve stopped going to church, but they told my mom that they miss me and wanna see me in the dress since they thought i looked pretty. when my mom told me this, i at first agreed because i didn t mind wearing it. it s a pretty dress that fits my curvy form and it made me feel confident for the first time to show the true outline of my tummy. but i quickly changed my mind after remembering my aunts, cousin, great grandma, and grandma were gonna be there. they always have something to say about how i look, how i dress, how fat my arms were getting, etc. and the had no problem showing it. my grandma was always the worst because no one has the guts to stand up to her, but me. even my own dad, her son, won t say anything when she makes comments like that. i know she will point out every flaw, every curve, and tell me i look too grown and no one will say anything. i wanna wear the dress because i miss my great grandfather and i know it ll make him happy. and god forbid this, but he s old and who knows if yk but i m scared of the backlash i ll get. i ve struggled with eating disorders for a lot of my life and currently am going through a small rough patch and don t want things to get more worse. but i wanna do this, but is it worth the risk? any advice?

lost appetite. i 19f have been struggling with my ana for 2 years now. my weight has quickly plummeted and i lost my period. i have been trying to start recovery these past two months, and it started okay. but for the past two weeks now i have no appetite. i get really hungry randomly, but then when i try to eat i take two bites and just can t eat anymore eventhough i m still hungry. i just lose my appetite and no longer can eat the food. this happens with any food i try to eat and it s becoming very frustrating. my stomach hasn t shrunk that much has it??? anyways could i get some advice on how to overcome this awkward part of recovery? i hate seeing the look on my parents and bf face when i barely touch my food : but i really just cannot eat eventhough i want to and try to. thank you in advance edit: thank you guys for all ur advice so far i m going to be trying them out and hope for the best

fuck this disorder in the a . so yesterday i had a birthday party, and in the morning i had a snack pack cheese and crackers thing, 17 cals, then i made myself a zero shirley temple 1 cals 1 can sprite zero, 2 tbsp grenadine, and 2 maraschino cherries it's simple and yummy, aka cherry sprite with flare. anyways. to me, i had eaten enough . i went in for the party with a i'm going to eat and have a merry time, and not care about the food, i had a large muffin and a piece of cake. then, after the majority of people left mind you, this was at a public place, not a home. we were playing card games , i had started noticing a lot twitches in my hands, lips and tongue. i've had this before with low potassium, but i'm an idiot and let it go. so the night proceeds and i'm now starting to partially black out while sitting down, and i'm unsteady in my seat like i'm drunk or something, this is a caf we're in, and we're not drinking. so i take one of the emergency potassium pills i had i use to get them prescribed when i abused laxatives, so i have some left over and i use them rarely, in cases like this because i'm stupid and i don't go to the hospital like i should . i was legitimately scared at this point; i had never felt quite this bad before. my boyfriend and his friend suggest i should probably eat something and i second that idea because i don't want to kill over on the caf floor and make a scene. i go up and to get a sandwich and some chips. when i was looking at the sandwiches, i almost fell over and couldn't properly read the names because my vision was blackening and was in and out of focus. as i ate the sandwich, my boyfriend brought me an orange juice because he's a thinker, just in case it was low blood sugar, even though i just had cake an hour earlier. i began to get my vision back; that was the scariest part for me, not being able to see, then i finished everything, mentally being screamed at by my ed, and my stomach feeling absolutely awful. but i'm glad i ate the fucking sandwich and chips i felt better, not all the way, though. i was still twitching some but not as bad, but my unsteady feeling and blackout vision issues had gone away. not 1 , but i didn't feel like death anymore. now, here i am the day after, back to restricting when there is no rhyme or reason for this disorder, and we do the shit it says without question. stay strong out there; one day, we'll be better. tl;dr had a potential medical emergency, some potassium, and a sandwich saved the day.

haven't been diagnosed with an ed, i'm here because i need help.. for the past year and a half i have been struggling to eat. i will be so so hungry and then the thought of food is revolting. or i'll be in the middle of enjoying a delicious meal and all the sudden quite literally out of nowhere, no triggers i cannot eat anymore. i'm not full, i'm still hungry, but i can't. if it happens in the middle of chewing i make myself swallow the last bite, but sometimes i vomit if i try to force it down. as stated, i have not been diagnosed with an eating disorder. i genuinely don't have body image issues, i am happy with my weight and the way that i look. also, i'm a foodie, i love food, i love cooking, baking, i even like to can vegetables from my garden. but now, i can't even eat half a meal. i'm honestly devastated by how this has been progressing. i can tell it's taking a toll on my body. i do my best to get calories down to get myself through the day and try to eat things that are going to be more nutritious. i drink a lot of water. i'm fatigued, i don't sleep well, my body aches. i'm just tired of this. i want to eat. what is wrong with me? please if anyone can help me or give me some advice if you have dealt with something like this or know someone who has. i am desperate. i don't have health insurance so just going to get a checkup is a no go. i work outside on a tree farm nursery i love my job so i need to be able to eat. also, i know this is a page for eating disorders and i haven't been to a dr to discuss it, but as stated, no insurance. so if this isn't the right place to ask for some advice, would you please be kind enough to give me some resources to try out other subreddits, facebook groups, etc ? i truly appreciate it.

i'm not diagnosed, but i'd love some help advice . i'm a minor and i think i might have an ed. food eating causes a lot of stress and overthinking for me. problems really started around december. i started counting calories and felt guilty after i ate. i slept in to skip meals and weighed myself daily. this lasted for about a month. then i got back to over eating. i felt like i had no control over what i ate and felt super guilty after. i also gained back the weight i lost and felt really bad about it. i was still weighing myself and still hated myself. i wanted to get back "old me" who ate less. i realized that won't happen and started to panic. i started going on our treadmill daily. when i manage to minimise the amount of food i eat, i'm happy about it for some reason.tbh i'm always scared this "control" i have will go away again. it's also common for me to daydream about food. how i really want to eat something, but then the thought of calories and gaining weight stops me. after a while i can't stop myself anymore and eat a bunch of snacks. i sometimes hurt myself just cause i feel so much hatred towards myself. and i get triggered by ed s? idk how to explain. it simply makes me feel anxious or something. i'm honestly confused. this causes me so much stress. i'd be glad to hear any advice

i just want this to be over. i am a sixteen year old girl and my eating disorder started just after i turned fourteen, after years of hating my body. always had a bad body image, since six years old. i felt i wasnt good enough, ugly and fat although i was always a completely normal weight, a little bit chubby at times but totally healthy. then at fourteen i eventually started starving myself because of debilitating anxiety about my body. it started when i realized that skipping meals made me look less bloated and thus 'skinnier'. my stomach was always my worst insecurity anyway. when id eat a bit more i would get so anxious id have panic attacks when looking in the mirror, because of even minor bloating. then it escalated to restricting heavily for months and becoming just a pound from underweight. i felt so bad all the time but at least i finally was.. skinny, as id always wanted. then something snapped amp; i started binging. my mental health went to shit. because my body wasnt used to digesting the food, ironically that caused me actual, painful, uncomfortable bloating which convinced me i had gained a lot of weight. i got depressed amp; started self harming. was put into inpatient ed treatment. gained weight, more and more, until i was at a healthy weight for my body amp; hated myself more than ever. crash dieted, binged, repeated over and over again for a year. was at all kinds of different mental facilities because of my anxiety, panic attacks, dissociation and general unableness to live normally. then got a bit stabler as i was put on medication, and moved into a psychiatric unit. still live here ate mostly normally. bad body image, but managed it. i lost a bit weight at times, then binged it back, but i was generally so stable i could continue normal living despite of it. was happy, at times. got better. always wanted to be skinnier, but it didnt take over my life. had some periods of restricting, then started binging more severely, sometimes so much id throw up the next day accidentally, just because how much i ate and how sick it made me then go without eating a few days and try to get "back on track". lived a winter eating pretty normally, sometimes counted calories, sometimes didn't, no severe binging mostly. felt that i was doing well, actually. then decided i should, this time, actually lose weight, and take control, and that i could have the pretty body i always wanted this time. was determined to do it, ate 1 12 cals for a month. then snapped again despite trying to tell myself its "so easy for me" and got into a compulsive binging thats gone on for almost the last two weeks. so, repeating the cycle again. the cycle ive been repeating for two years. hating my body. for some time liking my body, but still not feeling good enough. wanting to be skinny, getting skinnier, feeling still bad and gaining the weight back, always in the normal ""healthy""" weight range. everyone thinks i am recovered from my eating disorder. i never chose to recover, i was forced to. i felt out of control. i always wished i could go back. i am tired. i am so tired. im having the same kinds of thoughts about my body weight as i did at fourteen, as it started. its gone on for too long. i cant tell anyone. they'd start monitoring my eating and weight. then i couldnt lose weight, and i would have to live with a body i dont like, which would most likely cause me to binge, which would alienate me from my body, which would make me feel even worse. out of control. as its been. i dont want this anymore. im tired. so tired. sorry for the bad writing i am crying as i write this. dont speak english as my first language, cant bother to think about it so hard. i feel so hopeless.

anyone else depressed because you have relapsed? need some kind words. hi all, long story short, i am a 21 year old male who used to be quite overweight. my coping mechanism for anxiety was to eat, and naturally it caused its repercussions. this habit of mine lowered my will to do things i would normally do when healthier, and my days were moistened of sadness. but i overcame this during mid 2 2 and decided to change. success came to me after jogging regularly. life became happier. however, i was always obsessive, and i mean acutely obsessive, over my diet; i spat food, did not eat sufficiently, and smoked cigarettes to suppress my appetite, developing an addiction. and it is also worth mentioning that i was still unsure of my body, as i had always been bullied over it by family and peers in a classic manner. i then licked anorexia closely, while seeing an obese person in the mirror when in reality i was the other extreme opposite. this would sadden me deeply. then, i started gaining weight again, and now i am overweight because i either eat too much or nothing at all. this is ignominious, and it embarrasses me to write this, because i do not even reveal this to my loving girlfriend. i am humbled, brought down, and beaten by this. i still am obsessive over my body; looking at mirrors, window reflections, and avoiding cameras at all costs happens to me daily. i have thoughts of suicide and self hatred, which is an unwise way to fight the problem. nothing can bring me peace anymore, and i cannot exist in ease with myself, accepting my own body which is deservingly hated. i do not know what to call this. mine is a problem of anxiety, i would think, but i do not wish to diagnose myself. any kind words, experiences, and tips would be welcomed in my heart. thank you for reading.

in need of your help to raise awareness for eating disorder. hi everyone i'm lucie, and i m doing my undergraduate thesis project about eating disorder to honor my experience with ed, and i d love to talk to some of you who have experience in participating in a support group, in either online or offline format, and both long term participants and people who tried and stopped participating would be very helpful to my project dm me if you are interested in helping long version: my name is lucie tsao, and i am currently in hong kong. under the crazy diet culture here and very strict body requirements for women, my life always gets so influenced by them. i have always struggled with my eating habits because growing up even my parents always encouraged the eating disorder behaviors. after i finally got to know the concept of eating disorder, i was able to gradually understand my behaviors and take control of them as good as i could. during my journey, i have gotten to know how little eating disorder is informed to the general public. as a sociology student, i thought i would grasp the chance and dedicate my thesis project to eating disorder. my purpose is to bring more understanding to the subject of eating disorder from a sociological perspective, and even within such a broad subject, eating disorder is not studied about as much as it should. for my project, we me and another girl who has also suffered from eating disorder are focusing on eating disorder as a social movement, and the major circumstance is eating disorder support group both online and offline format . inspired by the aids movement and also aa support groups, we think this is a very interesting topic that would bring more awareness to the concept of eating disorder in general, and there is clearly a research gap in this perspective. because we re located in asia currently, it is very rare to find people who have had experience in the support groups. i m here reaching out to you guys, hoping that we could maybe gather some useful and meaningful knowledge during the interview, you guys will be fully capable of stopping the interview or not answering any questions that make you uncomfortable, and since it is a sociological study, it is meant not to explore ed as a psychological disease but a disorder with social meanings and influences. i would love to hear from anyone who is interested in helping us raise awareness for ed
